Aleppo|agency=Anadolu Agency|date=5 May 2016}} * {{Flagicon image|Flag of the Al-Nusra Front.svg}} [[Al-Nusra Front]] * {{Flagicon image|Flag of Ahrar ash-Sham.svg}} [[Ahrar ash-Sham]] * {{Flagicon image|Flag of the Turkistan Islamic Party in Syria.svg}} [[Turkistan Islamic Party in Syria]]{{cite web|url=http://www.longwarjournal.org/archives/2016/05/jaysh-al-fath-coalition-launches-new-offensive-in-aleppo-province.php|title=Jaysh al Fath coalition launches new offensive in Aleppo province|work=The Long War Journal}} * {{flagicon image|Flag of Ajnad al-Sham.png}} [[Ajnad al-Sham]] * {{flagicon image|Flag of the Sham Legion.svg}} [[Sham Legion]] {{flagicon image|Flag of Jund al-Aqsa.svg}} [[Jund al-Aqsa]]

web|url=http://www.yenisafak.com/en/world/oppositions-agree-on-big-aleppo-operation-2444596|title=Oppositions agree on 'big Aleppo operation'|work=Yeni Safak|date=3 April 2016}} |units2={{flagicon image|Syrian Armed Forces Flag.svg}} [[Syrian Armed Forces]] * {{flagicon image|Syrian Arab Army Flag.svg}} [[Syrian Army]] ** [[File:Syrian 4th Armoured Division SSI.svg|23px]] [[4th Armoured Division (Syria)|4th Mechanized Division]] *** 154th Brigade * {{flagicon image|InfoboxNDF.png}} [[National Defence Forces (Syria)|National Defence Forces]] {{flagicon|Iran}} [[Armed Forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran|Iranian Armed Forces]] * {{flagicon image|Flag of the Army of the Guardians of the Islamic Revolution.svg}} [[Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps|IRGC]]{{cite web|url=http://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/russia-truce-syrias-aleppo-extended-days-38949740|title=13 Members of Iran's Elite Force Killed in Syria|author=|publisher=ABC News}} ** [[Quds Force]] ** [[25th Karbala Division]] * [[Iranian Army]] ** [[65th Airborne Special Forces Brigade (Iran)|65th Airborne Special Forces Brigade]] {{flagicon image|Banner of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation (obverse).svg}} [[Russian Armed Forces]] * {{flagicon image|Flag of the Air Force of the Russian Federation.svg}} [[Russian Air Force]] |strength1= |strength2= |casualties1 = 285 killed{{cite web|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/news/fierce-fighting-near-aleppo-as-syria-cease-fire-starts-to-unravel/|title=Fierce fighting near Aleppo as Syria cease-fire starts to unravel|date=2 April 2016|publisher=CBS News}}{{cite web|url=http://www.dailystar.com.lb/News/Middle-East/2016/Apr-13/347242-over-100-killed-in-upsurge-in-syrias-aleppo-activists.ashx|title=Over 100 killed in upsurge in Syria's Aleppo: activists|work=The Daily Star Newspaper – Lebanon|accessdate=14 April 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://www.syriahr.com/2016/06/04/201-%d9%82%d8%b6%d9%88%d8%a7-%d8%a3%d9%85%d8%b3-%d8%a8%d9%8a%d9%86%d9%87%d9%85-55-%d9%85%d9%86-%d8%b9%d9%86%d8%a7%d8%b5%d8%b1-%d9%82%d9%88%d8%a7%d8%aa-%d8%a7%d9%84%d9%86%d8%b8%d8%a7%d9%85-%d9%88%d8%a7/|title=201 قضوا أمس بينهم 55 من عناصر قوات النظام والمسلحين الموالين لها، و72 استشهدوا وقضوا في قصف جوي وقصف للتحالف الدولي وسقوط قذائف وقصف لقوات النظام وظروف ثانية|first=|last=user3|publisher=|accessdate=28 July 2016}} |casualties2 = 255 killed |casualties3 = }} {{Campaignbox Syrian Civil War}} {{Campaignbox Battle of Aleppo}} The '''2016 Southern Aleppo campaign''' was a series of [[military operation]]s that started on 1 April when the [[Islamist]] rebel coalition [[Army of Conquest]], led by the [[al-Nusra Front]], launched a surprise{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/khan-touman-recapture-becomes-inevitable-due-syrian-army-high-ground/|title=Khan Touman recapture becomes inevitable due to Syrian Army high ground|first=Chris|last=Tomson|date=9 May 2016|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=28 July 2016}} [[Offensive (military)|offensive]] south of [[Aleppo]]. The main objective of the operation was to recapture territory they had lost during the [[Aleppo offensive (October–December 2015)|large-scale government offensive]] in late 2015.{{cite web|url=https://www.hindustantimes.com/world/fierce-fighting-kills-35-around-syria-s-aleppo-monitor/story-soLx7oL5U1y6pV0J5D9e5I.html|title=Fierce fighting kills 35 around Syria's Aleppo: monitor|work=AFP|accessdate=14 April 2016}} ==Campaign== ===First offensive (April 2016)=== In the afternoon of 1 April, rebel forces launched the offensive, targeting the strategic village of Tel el-Ais,{{cite web |url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/rebels-launch-important-offensive-southern-aleppo/|title=Rebels launch important offensive in southern Aleppo|author=Leith Fadel|date=1 April 2016|work=[[Al-Masdar News]]}} that overlooks the Damascus–Aleppo highway. The operation started with preparatory shelling hitting the village's southwestern flank.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/rebels-storm-strategic-town-southern-aleppo/|title=Rebels storm strategic village in southern Aleppo|author=Leith Fadel|date=1 April 2016|work=[[Al-Masdar News]]}} This was followed up by a ground assault that included an attack conducted by three suicide car bombers against government positions.{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mideast-crisis-syria-aleppo-idUSKCN0WZ0O5|title=Nusra Front, Syrian rebels attack government forces near Aleppo, gain ground|author=Reuters Editorial|date=2 April 2016|work=Reuters}} According to one report, the bombers did not reach their targets, while according to another, they managed to clear the way for the rebel infantry.{{cite web|url=http://www.longwarjournal.org/archives/2016/04/al-nusrah-front-allies-launch-offensive-south-of-aleppo.php|title=Al Nusrah Front, allies launch offensive south of Aleppo|work=The Long War Journal}} Still, the attack on Tel el-Ais was eventually repelled. However, soon after, the rebels launched a second assault,{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/breaking-rebels-capture-strategic-town-southern-aleppo/|title=Breaking: Rebels capture strategic town in southern Aleppo|author=Leith Fadel|date=2 April 2016|work=[[Al-Masdar News]]}} and early on 2 April, they captured Tel el-Ais.{{cite web|url=http://www.foxnews.com/world/2016/04/02/al-qaida-other-insurgents-capture-syrian-village.html|title=Al-Qaida, other insurgents capture Syrian village|work=[[Fox News]]}} The Al-Nusra Front claimed they ambushed government troops as they were withdrawing from the village. After securing the village, the rebels proceeded to attack and seize the Jabal Al-'Eiss (Mount Eiss) area, with the Army withdrawing towards Hader.{{cite web |url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/rebels-advance-southern-aleppo-amid-heavy-casualties/|title=Rebels advance in southern Aleppo amid heavy casualties|author=Leith Fadel|date=3 April 2016|work=[[Al-Masdar News]]}} Meanwhile, elsewhere along the frontline, the rebels captured the villages of Abu Ruwayl, Hawbar and Birnah as the offensive started, however they were recaptured by the military by the following morning.{{cite tweet|user=ThomasVLinge|author=Thomas van Linge|number=716270493528158208|date=2 April 2016|title=#Syria: map by opposition media, where rebels/jihadists captured al-Eis the regime recaptured Abu Ruwayl & Hawbar}}{{cite tweet|user=DPRKJones|author=Jason Jones|number=716336469246234624|date=2 April 2016|title=#SAA/Allies retake Birnah and Abu Ruwayl South #Aleppo. T-72M1 with Mirage APS and BM-21 Grad barrage.}} Among the dead on the government side from the previous two days of fighting were 12 Hezbollah fighters{{cite web|url=http://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/activists-battle-syria-kills-hezbollah-fighters-38116198|title=After Palmyra, Syrian Troops Take Another IS-Controlled Town|author=ABC News|work=ABC News}} and three IRGC officers.{{cite web|url=http://aranews.net/2016/04/three-senior-iranian-officers-killed-confrontations-syrian-rebels-aleppo/|title=Three senior Iranian officers killed in confrontations with Syrian rebels in Aleppo – ARA News|work=ARA News}} As of early 3 April, a counter-attack had not yet started as government forces were awaiting the arrival of the final batch of ammunition and vehicles. Later in the day, a rebel source stated 100 government vehicles were seen heading towards the southern countryside of Aleppo.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/IvanSidorenko1/status/716506574500532224|title=Ivan Sidorenko|work=Twitter}}{{dead link|date=January 2018|fix-attempted=yes|bot=TweetCiteBot}} At 10 p.m. that evening,{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/hezbollah-syrian-army-storm-strategic-town-southern-aleppo/|title=Hezbollah, Syrian Army storm strategic town in southern Aleppo|author=Leith Fadel|date=4 April 2016|work=[[Al-Masdar News]]}} the Army counter-attack started and government forces reportedly captured several points on the eastern and northern perimeter of Tel el-Ais, coming to within a few hundred meters of the village.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-begins-counter-offensive-southern-aleppo-russia-pounds-al-eis/|title=Syrian Army begins counter-offensive in southern Aleppo as Russia pounds al-Eis|author=Chris Tomson|date=4 April 2016|work=[[Al-Masdar News]]}} Still, by the morning, two attacks to breach the village itself had been repelled, although the main assault had not yet taken place as airstrikes continued. On 5 April, a Syrian Air Force plane was shot down in the area of Tel el-Ais by the Al-Nusra Front,{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/apr/05/syria-monitor-rebels-shoot-down-warplane-south-of-aleppo|title=Syrian jet downed near Aleppo as fighting picks up across country|author=Kareem Shaheen|work=the Guardian}} with the pilot captured.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/al-nusra-aircraft-captures-pilot-aleppo/|title=Al-Nusra downs aircraft, captures pilot in Aleppo (Video)|author=Paul Antonopoulos|date=5 April 2016|work=[[Al-Masdar News]]}}{{cite web|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/islamist-rebels-shoot-down-syrian-warplane-1459872490|title=Islamist Rebels Shoot Down Syrian Warplane|author=Sam Dagher|date=5 April 2016|work=WSJ|accessdate=7 April 2016}} During the day, members of the Iranian 65th Airborne Special Forces Brigade reportedly arrived in Hader.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/iranian-special-forces-arrive-aleppo/|title=Iranian Special Forces arrive in Aleppo|author=Leith Fadel|date=5 April 2016|work=[[Al-Masdar News]]|accessdate=7 April 2016}} For the first time since February, Russian air-strikes were conducted in the southern Aleppo countryside, in preparation for the Army counter-attack.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/breaking-russian-fighter-jets-pound-southern-aleppo/|title=Breaking: Russian fighter jets pound southern Aleppo|author=Leith Fadel|date=5 April 2016|work=[[Al-Masdar News]]|accessdate=7 April 2016}} Late on 5 April, the Iranian special forces, supported by Syrian Army troops, attacked the village. In the early hours of the next day,{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/strategic-town-al-eis-recaptured-night-raid-led-iranian-troops-map-update/|title=Strategic town of Al-Eis recaptured during night raid led by Iranian troops – Map update|author=Chris Tomson|date=6 April 2016|work=[[Al-Masdar News]]|accessdate=7 April 2016}}{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mideast-crisis-syria-aleppo-idUSKCN0X30N4|title=Syrian army and allies launch attack south of Aleppo|author=Tom Perry|date=6 April 2016|work=Reuters|accessdate=7 April 2016}} it was incorrectly claimed they recaptured Tel el-Ais.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/currently-battlefield-update-southern-aleppo/|title=Current battlefield update from southern Aleppo|author=Leith Fadel|date=6 April 2016|work=[[Al-Masdar News]]|accessdate=7 April 2016}} Still, pro-opposition [[Syrian Observatory for Human Rights|SOHR]] confirmed government troops made progress in the area of Tel el-Ais. During the day, the rebels temporarily withdrew from the village due to heavy shelling before returning. Elsewhere, the military captured Zorba, but it was recaptured by the rebels one hour later.[https://twitter.com/IvanSidorenko1/status/717543157886427137] [https://twitter.com/IvanSidorenko1/status/717557432273076224] The same day, another large Army convoy arrived in the area.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/massive-syrian-army-convoy-arrives-southern-aleppo/|title=Massive Syrian Army convoy arrives in southern Aleppo|author=Leith Fadel|date=6 April 2016|work=[[Al-Masdar News]]|accessdate=7 April 2016}} On 9 April, the rebels took control of the village of Khalidiyah, near [[Khan Tuman]],{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/rebels-capture-al-khalidyah-tides-turn-southern-aleppo-map-update/|title=Rebels capture al-Khalidyah as tides turn in southern Aleppo – Map update|author=Chris Tomson|date=9 April 2016|work=[[Al-Masdar News]]|accessdate=14 April 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://www.syriahr.com/?p=165871|title=هجوم عنيف وتقدم للفصائل وجبهة النصرة في محيط خان طومان واشتباكات في محيط الشيخ مقصود|author=suliman|work=المرصد السورى لحقوق الإنسان|accessdate=14 April 2016}} as well as two hilltops{{cite web|url=http://news.trust.org/item/20160409223747-jad0k|title=Rebels and Syrian government forces battle in fierce clashes near Aleppo – monitor|author=Thomson Reuters Foundation|publisher=|accessdate=14 April 2016}} and large parts of Zaytan, Birnah and al-Qal'ajiyyeh.{{cite web|url=http://www.syriahr.com/en/2016/04/10/jabhat-al-nusra-and-factions-advance-in-several-fronts-at-the-expense-of-the-regime-forces-in-the-southern-countryside-of-aleppo-and-about-40-airstrike-target-the-area/|title=Jabhat Al-Nusra and factions advance in several fronts at the expense of the regime forces in the southern countryside of Aleppo and about 40 airstrike target the area|work=SOHR|date=10 April 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://www.voanews.com/content/syrian-cease-fire-fraying-aleppo-in-regime-sights/3279948.html|title=Syrian Cease-fire Fraying; Aleppo in Regime Sights|work=VOA|accessdate=14 April 2016}} Meanwhile, government forces intensified their shelling of Tel el-Ais and nearby Zorba, with over 100 mortars and rockets being fired at rebel positions, while Russian air-strikes continued.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-irgc-intensify-attack-southern-aleppo-amid-coming-offensive/|title=Syrian Army, IRGC intensify attack in southern Aleppo amid the coming offensive|author=Leith Fadel|date=9 April 2016|work=[[Al-Masdar News]]|accessdate=14 April 2016}} The next day, the military recaptured Khalidiyah and the rebels withdrew from Zaytan, Birnah and other positions they had taken during the previous 24 hours.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/rebel-offensive-southern-aleppo-fails-syrian-army-hezbollah-recapture-al-khalidiyah/|title=Rebel offensive in southern Aleppo fails as the Syrian Army, Hezbollah recapture Al-Khalidiyah|author=Leith Fadel|date=10 April 2016|work=[[Al-Masdar News]]|accessdate=14 April 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://qasioun.net/en/news/show/22826/Hours_After_Seize_Over_Khaldiah_Village%E2%80%A6Syrian_Opposition_withdrawal|title=Qasion News Agency|publisher=|accessdate=14 April 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://www.syriahr.com/?p=165947|title=معارك متواصلة وقوات النظام تنفذ هجوماً معاكساً بريف حلب الجنوبي وتتقدم في عدة محاور|author=khaled|work=المرصد السورى لحقوق الإنسان|accessdate=14 April 2016}} During the rebel assault on Khalidiyah and Khan Tuman, four Iranian commandos were killed, including two members of the 65th Airborne Special Forces Brigade.{{cite web|url=http://www.tasnimnews.com/en/news/2016/04/12/1046890/funeral-held-for-iranian-commandos-killed-in-syria|title=Tasnim News Agency – Funeral Held for 4 Iranian Commandos Killed in Syria|work=Tasnim News Agency|accessdate=14 April 2016}} On 12 April, a new government assault on Tel el-Ais started.{{cite web|url=http://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/syrian-government-launches-offensive-south-aleppo-38325735|title=Syria Pushes Offensive on Eve of Elections, Talks in Geneva|author=ABC News|work=ABC News|accessdate=14 April 2016}} Before the attack, 300 rockets were launched at rebel positions in the area.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/hezbollah-verge-liberating-al-eis-south-aleppo/|title=Breaking: Syrian Army, Hezbollah storm Al-Eis in South Aleppo|author=Paul Antonopoulos|date=12 April 2016|work=[[Al-Masdar News]]|accessdate=14 April 2016}} Fighting also took place near Khan Tuman. The Army managed to advance and capture several hills in the area,{{cite web|url=http://www.syriahr.com/?p=166209|title=استمرار الاشتباكات بشكل عنيف في منقطتي خان طومان والعيس وقوات النظام تواصل قصفها المكثف للمنطقة|author=khaled|work=المرصد السورى لحقوق الإنسان|accessdate=14 April 2016}} as well as most of the village itself.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/hezbollah-assault-al-eis-southern-aleppo-repelled-jabhat-al-nusra/|title=Hezbollah assault on Al-Eis in southern Aleppo repelled by Jabhat al-Nusra|author=Chris Tomson|date=12 April 2016|work=[[Al-Masdar News]]|accessdate=14 April 2016}} However, this latest attack on Tel el-Ais was also eventually repelled,{{cite web|url=http://qasioun.net/en/news/show/23028/among_regime_soldiers_had_been_reportedly_killed__opposition|title=Qasion News Agency|publisher=|accessdate=14 April 2016}} when government forces withdrew from the village after not being able to take Jabal Al-'Eiss hill. The hills that they had also seized earlier in the day were once again under rebel control.{{cite web|url=http://www.syriahr.com/?p=166214|title=معارك مستمرة بعنف تزامناً مع ضربات مكثفة على منطقة العيس بريف حلب الجنوبي وقصف يستهدف مارع|author=khaled|work=المرصد السورى لحقوق الإنسان|accessdate=14 April 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://www.syriahr.com/?p=166223|title=الفصائل الإسلامية والمقاتلة تعاود التقدم بريف حلب الشمالي ومعارك مستمرة بالريف الجنوبي|author=khaled|work=المرصد السورى لحقوق الإنسان|accessdate=14 April 2016}} ===Interlude=== One week after the end of the offensive, the rebels once again launched a two-pronged attack against Khan Tuman, Zaytan and Birnah. The attack was quickly repelled, with more than 30 rebels reportedly being killed at Khan Tuman and two of their tanks being destroyed.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/rebel-offensive-southern-aleppo-turns-disastrous-due-syrian-army-intel/|title=Rebel offensive in southern Aleppo turns disastrous due to Syrian Army intel|first=Chris|last=Tomson|date=19 April 2016|publisher=}} ===Second offensive (May 2016)=== On 5 May, the United States and Russia agreed on a cessation of hostilities in Aleppo for 48 hours. However, fighting continued in the city and surrounding areas.{{Cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mideast-crisis-syria-aleppo-idUSKCN0XV0NT|title=U.S., Russia agree to extend truce to Aleppo|work=Reuters|date=5 May 2016}} The same day, the [[Army of Conquest]] militants, supported by [[Jund al-Aqsa]] and the [[Turkistan Islamic Party in Syria]] (TIP), advanced and captured the village of Khalidiyah, west of [[Khan Tuman]] and southwest of Aleppo.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/jihadist-rebels-capture-khan-touman-tank-hill-southern-aleppo/|title=Jihadist rebels capture Khan Touman, Al-Khalidiyah in southern Aleppo|author=Leith Fadel|date=6 May 2016|work=[[Al-Masdar News]]|accessdate=6 May 2016}} The rebels then launched artillery attack on Khan Tuman. During the fighting, the Army destroyed a [[car bomb]] with a rocket.{{Cite web|url=http://www.business-standard.com/article/news-ians/jihadist-groups-unleash-offensive-south-of-syria-s-aleppo-116050600077_1.html|title=Jihadist groups unleash offensive south of Syria's Aleppo|work=Business Standard|date=6 May 2016}} Around 7 a.m. on 6 May,{{cite web|url=http://bigstory.ap.org/article/a9329cc613a444b5b1f2b8b189aea6cb/activists-insurgents-seize-village-south-aleppo|title=Activists: Insurgents seize village south of Aleppo|work=The Big Story|accessdate=6 May 2016}} the rebels captured Khan Tuman, as well as five other nearby villages.{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mideast-crisis-syria-village-idUSKCN0XX0C6|title=Islamist rebels seize village near Aleppo, 73 killed: monitor|work=Reuters|date=6 May 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://www.syriahr.com/2016/05/06/%D8%A3%D9%83%D8%AB%D8%B1-%D9%85%D9%86-73-%D9%82%D8%B6%D9%88%D8%A7-%D9%88%D9%82%D8%AA%D9%84%D9%88%D8%A7-%D8%AE%D9%84%D8%A7%D9%84-%D8%B3%D9%8A%D8%B7%D8%B1%D8%A9-%D8%AC%D9%86%D8%AF-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%A3/|title=أكثر من 73 قضوا وقتلوا خلال سيطرة جند الأقصى النصرة والفصائل على بلدة خان طومان وقرى قربها جنوب حلب|author=khaled|work=المرصد السورى لحقوق الإنسان|accessdate=6 May 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://www.qasioun.net/en/news/show/25214/Nusra_front_seize_over_Maarta_village_and_Khantouman_town|title=Qasion News Agency – Nusra front seize over Maarta village and Khantouman town|publisher=|accessdate=6 May 2016}} In all, 62 pro-government fighters and 57 rebels were killed in the rebel assault.{{cite web|url=https://www.facebook.com/syriahroe/posts/861638710611135|title=Rose to 119 the number of fighters who... – Syrian Observatory for Human Rights – Facebook|publisher=}} During the clashes, an air strike hit a heavy concentration of rebels, killing 18 fighters.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/pictures-nusra-loses-top-commanders-southern-aleppo/|title=In pictures: Nusra loses top commanders in southern Aleppo|author=Zen Adra|date=6 May 2016|work=[[Al-Masdar News]]}} Following the capture of Khan Tuman, hundreds of government reinforcements, including Palestinian militiamen, were sent to help recapture the town.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-liwaa-al-quds-send-reinforcements-southern-aleppo/|title= Syrian Army, Liwaa Al-Quds send reinforcements to southern Aleppo|work=[[Al-Masdar News]]|date=6 May 2016}} Preparations were being made for a counter-attack, with Russian air-strikes reportedly hitting rebel positions in the area.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/russian-air-force-strikes-jihadist-rebels-khan-touman/|title=Russian Air Force strikes the jihadist rebels at Khan Touman|author=Leith Fadel|date=6 May 2016|work=[[Al-Masdar News]]}} On 7 May, government troops recaptured three villages.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/hezbollah-syrian-army-recapture-3-villages-southern-aleppo/|title=Hezbollah, Syrian Army recapture 2 villages in southern Aleppo (video)|author=Leith Fadel|date=7 May 2016|work=[[Al-Masdar News]]}}
[https://twitter.com/archicivilians/status/728980352694419458]
[https://twitter.com/islamicworldupd/status/728982664821256192] The counter-attack against Khan Tuman started on 8 May, and was reportedly repelled.{{cite web|url=http://www.qasioun.net/en/news/show/25479/Al_fateh_army_defeat_attack_by_regime_forces_on_Khan_Toman|title=Qasion News Agency – Al-fateh army defeat attack by regime forces on Khan Toman|publisher=|accessdate=10 May 2016}} By 11 May, the fighting in the area of Khan Tuman left 173 fighters dead on both sides and more than 300 wounded. Among those killed on the rebel side were 35 Turkistan Islamic Party members as well as a number of Uzbeks. Among pro-government dead were 55 Afghans, Iranians, Iraqis and Lebanese.{{cite web|url=https://www.facebook.com/syriahroe/photos/a.150495128392167.28686.121855461256134/863738203734519/?type=3&theater|title=More than 500 killed or wounded, during... – Syrian Observatory for Human Rights – Facebook|publisher=|accessdate=15 May 2016}} Overnight between 11 and 12 May, heavy Russian air-strikes hit rebel positions in the area of Khan Tuman.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/russian-fighter-jets-pound-southern-aleppo-overnight/|title=Russian fighter jets pound southern Aleppo overnight|author=News Desk|date=12 May 2016|work=[[Al-Masdar News]]|accessdate=15 May 2016}}{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/khan-touman-fire-due-russian-airstrikes-artillery-shelling/|title=Khan Touman on fire due to Russian airstrikes and artillery shelling|author=Chris Tomson|date=12 May 2016|work=[[Al-Masdar News]]|accessdate=15 May 2016}} ===Third offensive (June 2016)=== On 3 June, a new surprise rebel offensive was started.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/government-frontline-collapses-southern-aleppo-blitz-offensive-rebels/|title=Government frontline collapses in southern Aleppo after blitz offensive by rebels|first=Chris|last=Tomson|date=3 June 2016|publisher=|accessdate=17 June 2016}} al-Nusra [[suicide bomber]]s detonated [[car bomb]]s near Khan Tuman, followed by an assault with [[heavy armour]] toward pro-government positions. [[Ahrar al-Sham]] then seized the village of Maratah, capturing a large amount [[munitions]] crates, a [[T-62]], and a fuel depot.{{Cite web|url=http://www.longwarjournal.org/archives/2016/06/al-nusrah-front-and-allies-launch-new-offensive-in-syrias-aleppo-province.php|title=Al Nusrah Front and allies launch new offensive in Syria's Aleppo province|work=Long War Journal|date=4 June 2016}} The rebels also took over three more villages, an air defence battalion, and a weapons warehouse.{{cite web|url=http://www.al-monitor.com/pulse/originals/2016/06/syria-aleppo-regime-fsa-wider-battle-takeover.html|title=Major regime offensive looms over Aleppo|work=Al-Monitor|date=6 June 2016}} By the next day, the rebels had taken control of five villages.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/drone-footage-reveals-massive-jabhat-al-nusra-offensive-southern-aleppo/|title=Drone footage reveals massive Jabhat al-Nusra offensive in southern Aleppo|first=Chris|last=Tomson|date=4 June 2016|publisher=|accessdate=17 June 2016}} The same day, the [[Sham Legion]] launched an [[anti-tank guided missile]] at a suspected [[Syrian Army]] position near the area, killing a [[Dagestan]]i [[al-Qaeda]] commander in a [[friendly fire]] incident. On 14 June, al-Nusra led a fresh jihadist assault in the southern Aleppo countryside, targeting the villages of Khalsah and Zeitain, controlled by a number of pro-government forces. The jihadists initially captured Zeitain, whilst heavy fighting continued in Khalsah.{{Cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/jihadists-capture-zeitan-southern-aleppo/|title=Al Nusra capture Zeitain in South Aleppo|work=Al Masdar News|date=14 June 2016}} On 15 June, the [[National Defence Forces (Syria)|National Defence Forces]], [[Hezbollah]] and allied forces launched a counter-attack and succeeded in recapturing the village of Zeitan, whilst also repelling the jihadist assault on Khalsah. It was reported that over 20 jihadist fighters had been killed, whilst a rebel [[T-72]] tank and 2 BMP's were destroyed.{{Cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/zeitan-recaptured-government-counter-offensive-unfolds-southern-aleppo/|title=Pro government forces repel jihadist assault in southern Aleppo|work=Al Masdar News|date=15 June 2016}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/hezbollah-returns-southern-aleppo-beat-back-jihadist-rebels/|title=Hezbollah return to Southern Aleppo to help repel jihadist assault|work=Al Masdar News|date=15 June 2016}} On 16 June, a pro-government counter-attack against Maratah was repelled.{{cite web|url=http://www.syriahr.com/en/2016/06/16/47656|title=12 Syrian and non-Syrian militants loyal to the regime killed during a counter attack on Maratah in the countryside of Aleppo|publisher=|accessdate=17 June 2016}} During the night of 17 and 18 June, the jihadist rebels led by al-Nusra imposed full control over the villages of Khalsah, Zeitan and Birnah, despite suffering heavy losses, including the death of a top commander.{{Cite web |url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/jihadists-capture-khalsah-southern-aleppo/|title=Al Nusra jihadists capture village of Khalsah|work=Al Masdar News|date=17 June 2016}}{{Cite web |url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/jihadists-capture-another-village-southern-aleppo/|title=Al Nusra led jihadists capture Zeitan|work=Al Masdar News|date=17 June 2016}}{{Cite web |url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/nusra-seizes-burnah-village-southern-aleppo/|title=Jihadists capture three villages in South Aleppo|work=Al Masdar News|date=18 June 2016}} Overall, 186 fighters on both sides were killed in the fighting over the previous four days, 100 rebels and 86 pro-government fighters.{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/wires/afp/article-3647995/IS-mounts-fierce-defence-besieged-Syrian-bastion.html|title=IS mounts fierce defence of besieged Syrian bastion|publisher=|accessdate=18 June 2016}} Muhaysini visited Turkistan Islamic Party fighters before the battle and performed [[dua]]. [[Khan Tuman]] in Aleppo then came under attack by the Uyghur [[Turkistan Islamic Party]].{{cite web |url=http://www.longwarjournal.org/archives/2016/05/turkistan-islamic-party-advertises-spoils-from-battle-in-aleppo.php |title=Turkistan Islamic Party advertises role in jihadist-led offensive in Aleppo province |last=Joscelyn |first=Thomas |date=May 7, 2016 |website=Long War Journal |publisher=Foundation for Defense of Democracies |access-date= |quote=}} {{cite web |url=http://kureselanaliz.com/2016/05/turkistan-islam-cemaatini-han-tumandan-aldigi-ganimetler-foto-galeri/ |title=Türkistan İslam Cemaati’nin Han Tuman’dan aldığı ganimetler (Foto Galeri) |last= |first= |date=7 May 2016 |website=KüreselAnaliz |publisher= |access-date= |quote=}}{{cite web |url=https://news.siteintelgroup.com/Jihadist-News/tip-division-in-syria-reports-participating-with-nf-jund-al-aqsa-in-liberating-khan-touman.html |title=TIP Division in Syria Reports Participating with NF, Jund al-Aqsa in Liberating Khan Touman |last= |first= |date=May 6, 2016 |website=SITE Intelligence Group |publisher= |access-date= |quote=}} A picture of Muhaysini with a Turkistan Islamic Party fighter in Khan Touman was released by the Turkistan Islamic Party after the battle.{{cite news |last= |first= |date= |title=اشغال خان‌طومان به روایت تروریست‌های چینی+عکس |url=http://www.jc313.ir/47057-%25D8%25A7%25D8%25B4%25D8%25BA%25D8%25A7%25D9%2584-%25D8%25AE%25D8%25A7%25D9%2586-%25D8%25B7%25D9%2588%25D9%2585%25D8%25A7%25D9%2586-%25D8%25A8%25D9%2587-%25D8%25B1%25D9%2588%25D8%25A7%25DB%258C%25D8%25AA-%25D8%25AA%25D8%25B1%25D9%2588%25D8%25B1%25DB%258C%25D8%25B3%25D8%25AA-%25D9%2587%25D8%25A7%25DB%258C-%25DA%2586%25DB%258C%25D9%2586%25DB%258C-%25D8%25B9%25DA%25A9%25D8%25B3.html |newspaper=جنبش سایبری 313 |location= |access-date= }}{{cite news |last= |first= |date= 10 May 2016 |title= اشغال خان‌طومان به روایت تروریست‌های چینی + تصاویر |url=http://www.ilna.ir/%D8%A8%D8%AE%D8%B4-%D8%B3%D8%A7%DB%8C%D8%B1-%D8%B1%D8%B3%D8%A7%D9%86%D9%87-%D9%87%D8%A7-10/369534-%D8%A7%D8%B4%D8%BA%D8%A7%D9%84-%D8%AE%D8%A7%D9%86-%D8%B7%D9%88%D9%85%D8%A7%D9%86-%D8%A8%D9%87-%D8%B1%D9%88%D8%A7%DB%8C%D8%AA-%D8%AA%D8%B1%D9%88%D8%B1%DB%8C%D8%B3%D8%AA-%D9%87%D8%A7%DB%8C-%DA%86%DB%8C%D9%86%DB%8C-%D8%AA%D8%B5%D8%A7%D9%88%DB%8C%D8%B1 |newspaper=ایلنا |location= |access-date= }} They displayed weapons and munitions seized during the battle. Corpses of what the TIP labelled as "Rawafid" (Shia) fighters and pictures of "Iranian" prisoners were released by the TIP.{{cite tweet|user=thomasjoscelyn|author=Thomas Joscelyn|number=730401207139897344|date=11 May 2016|title=TIP video includes other now standard images: tank, dead Shiites, burning Shiite flags, etc:|accessdate= }} {{cite tweet|user=thomasjoscelyn|author=Thomas Joscelyn|number=730394573462228993|date=11 May 2016|title=New Turkistan Islamic Party video: "Liberation of Al Khalidiya, Khan Tuman." Used aerial footage to plan attack.|accessdate= }} ==See also== {{Portal|Syrian Civil War}} * [[East Aleppo offensive (2015–16)]] * [[Northern Aleppo offensive (February 2016)]] * [[Northern Aleppo offensive (March–June 2016)]] * [[2016 Khanasir offensive]] * [[Aleppo offensive (June–August 2016)]] ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} {{Syrian Civil War}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Aleppo campaign, 2016}} [[Category:Military operations of the Syrian Civil War in 2016]] [[Category:Aleppo in the Syrian Civil War]] [[Category:Aleppo Governorate in the Syrian Civil War]] [[Category:April 2016 events]] [[Category:May 2016 events]] [[Category:June 2016 events]] [[Category:Military operations of the Syrian Civil War involving the Syrian government]] [[Category:Military operations of the Syrian Civil War involving Hezbollah]] [[Category:Military operations of the Syrian Civil War involving Quds Force]] [[Category:Military operations of the Syrian Civil War involving Russia]] [[Category:Military operations of the Syrian Civil War involving the al-Nusra Front]] [[Category:April 2016 events in Asia]] [[Category:May 2016 events in Asia]] [[Category:June 2016 events in Asia]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox planet | minorplanet = yes | name = 52246 Donaldjohanson | background = #D6D6D6 | image = | image_size = | caption = | discovery_ref =   | discovered = 2 March 1981 | discoverer = [[Schelte Bus|S. J. Bus]] | discovery_site = [[Siding Spring Observatory|Siding Spring Obs.]] | mpc_name = {{nowrap|(52246) Donaldjohanson}} | alt_names = {{mp|1981 EQ|5}}{{·}}{{mp|1998 YF|26}} | pronounced = | named_after = [[Donald Johanson]] 
{{small|([[paleoanthropologist]])}} | mp_category = [[main-belt]] {{·}}{{small|([[Kirkwood gap|inner]])}}
[[Erigone family|Erigone]]  | orbit_ref =   | epoch = 23 March 2018 ([[Julian day|JD]] 2458200.5) | uncertainty = 0 | observation_arc = 18.12 [[Julian year (astronomy)|yr]] (6,619 d) | aphelion = 2.8274 [[Astronomical unit|AU]] | perihelion = 1.9415 AU | semimajor = 2.3844 AU | eccentricity = 0.1858 | period = 3.68 yr (1,345 d) | mean_anomaly = 64.092[[Degree (angle)|°]] | mean_motion = {{Deg2DMS|0.2677|sup=ms}} / day | inclination = 4.4195° | asc_node = 262.84° | arg_peri = 213.10° | mean_diameter = {{val|3.895|0.013|ul=km}} | rotation = | albedo = {{val|0.103|0.019}} | spectral_type = [[C-type asteroid|C]]  | abs_magnitude = 15.5 }} '''52246 Donaldjohanson''', provisional designation {{mp|1981 EQ|5}}, is a carbonaceous Erigonian [[asteroid]] from the inner regions of the [[asteroid belt]], approximately {{convert|4|km|mi|abbr=off|sigfig=2|sp=us}} in diameter. It was discovered on 2 March 1981, by American astronomer [[Schelte Bus]] at the [[Siding Spring Observatory]] in Australia. The [[C-type asteroid]] is a target of the [[Lucy (spacecraft)|''Lucy'' mission]] and was aptly named after American paleoanthropologist [[Donald Johanson]]. == Orbit and classification == ''Donaldjohanson'' is a member of the [[Erigone family]] ({{small|[[FIN tbl#406|406]]}}), a large carbonaceous [[asteroid family]] of nearly 2,000 known members, which is named after its [[parent body]] [[163 Erigone]]. It is a relatively old family that was created approximately 130 million years ago. It orbits the Sun in the [[Kirkwood gap|inner]] asteroid belt at a distance of 1.9–2.8 [[Astronomical unit|AU]] once every 3 years and 8 months (1,345 days; [[semi-major axis]] of 2.38 AU). Its orbit has an [[orbital eccentricity|eccentricity]] of 0.19 and an [[orbital inclination|inclination]] of 4[[Degree (angle)|°]] with respect to the [[ecliptic]]. A first [[precovery]] was taken at the discovering observatory in February 1981, extending the body's [[observation arc]] by 2 weeks prior to its official discovery observation. == ''Lucy'' mission target == ''Donaldjohanson'' is planned to be visited by the [[Lucy (spacecraft)|''Lucy'' spacecraft]] which will launch in 2021. The flyby is scheduled for 20 April 2025, and will approach the asteroid to a distance of 922 kilometers at a velocity of 13.4 kilometers per second. The mission's targets with their flyby dates are:https://www.hou.usra.edu/meetings/lpsc2017/pdf/2025.pdf * '''52246 Donaldjohanson''' — 20 April 2025: 4 km diameter C-type asteroid in the inner main-belt, member of the Erigone family; * [[3548 Eurybates]] — 12 August 2027: 64 km diameter C-type Jupiter Trojan in the Greek camp at {{L4}}, largest member of the only confirmed disruptive collisional family in the Trojans; * [[15094 Polymele]] — 15 September 2027: 21 km diameter P-type Trojan at {{L4|nolink=yes}}, likely collisional fragment; * [[11351 Leucus]] — 18 April 2028: 34 km diameter D-type [[List of slow rotators (minor planets)|slow rotator]] Trojan at {{L4|nolink=yes}}; * [[21900 Orus]] — 11 November 2028: 51 km diameter D-type Trojan at {{L4|nolink=yes}}; * [[617 Patroclus]] — 2 March 2033: P-type [[binary asteroid|binary]] Trojan. The primary, Patroclus, has a mean diameter of 113 km and its companion, Menoetius, has a diameter of 104 km. The pair orbit at a separation of 680 km. The binary resides in the [[Trojan camp]] at {{L5}}. == Physical characteristics == ''Donaldjohanson'' has been characterized as a carbonaceous [[C-type asteroid]], in-line with the C and [[C-type asteroid|X]] overall [[Asteroid spectral type|spectral type]] for Erigonian asteroids.{{rp|23}} It has an [[absolute magnitude]] of 15.5. As of 2018, the asteroid's [[rotation period|period]], [[Poles of astronomical bodies|pole]] and shape remain unknown. === Diameter and albedo === According to the survey carried out by NASA's [[Wide-field Infrared Survey Explorer]] with its subsequent [[NEOWISE]] mission, ''Donaldjohanson'' measures 3.895 kilometers in diameter and its surface has an [[astronomical albedo|albedo]] of 0.103. == Naming == This [[minor planet]] is planned to be visited by the ''[[Lucy (spacecraft)|Lucy]]'' spacecraft, which would observe it en route to its main target of several [[Jupiter trojans]]. The Lucy probe is named after the [[Lucy (Australopithecus)|"Lucy" hominid fossil]], while Donaldjohanson is named for that fossil's co-discoverer [[Donald Johanson]] (born 1943), an American [[paleoanthropologist]]. The approved naming citation was published by the [[Minor Planet Center]] on 25 December 2015 ({{small|[[Minor Planet Circulars|M.P.C.]] 97569}}). == See also == * [[Discovery program]] == References == {{reflist|30em|refs= {{cite web |type = 2017-01-29 last obs. |title = JPL Small-Body Database Browser: 52246 Donaldjohanson (1981 EQ5) |url = https://ssd.jpl.nasa.gov/sbdb.cgi?sstr=2052246 |publisher = [[Jet Propulsion Laboratory]] |accessdate = 28 April 2018}} {{cite web |title = 52246 Donaldjohanson (1981 EQ5) |work = Minor Planet Center |url = https://www.minorplanetcenter.net/db_search/show_object?object_id=52246 |accessdate = 28 April 2018}} {{cite web |title = MPC/MPO/MPS Archive |work = Minor Planet Center |url = https://www.minorplanetcenter.net/iau/ECS/MPCArchive/MPCArchive_TBL.html |accessdate = 28 April 2018}} {{cite web |title = NASA announces five Discovery proposals selected for further study |date = 30 September 2015 |author1 = Casey Dreier |author2 = Emily Lakdawalla |publisher = The Planetary Society |url = http://www.planetary.org/blogs/casey-dreier/2015/09301336-discovery-downselect.html |accessdate = 12 April 2017}} {{Cite journal |first1 = H. F. |last1 = Levison |first2 = C. |last2 = Olkin |first3 = K. S. |last3 = Noll |first4 = S. |last4 = Marchi |first5 = |last5 = Lucy Team |date = March 2017 |title = Lucy: Surveying the Diversity of the Trojan Asteroids: The Fossils of Planet Formation |url = https://www.hou.usra.edu/meetings/lpsc2017/pdf/2025.pdf |journal = 48th Lunar and Planetary Science Conference |bibcode = 2017LPI....48.2025L |access-date= 13 April 2017}} {{Cite journal |first1 = D. |last1 = Nesvorný |first2 = M. |last2 = Broz |first3 = V. |last3 = Carruba |date = December 2014 |title = Identification and Dynamical Properties of Asteroid Families |url = https://arxiv.org/pdf/1502.01628.pdf |journal = Asteroids IV |pages = 297–321 |bibcode = 2015aste.book..297N |doi = 10.2458/azu_uapress_9780816532131-ch016 |arxiv = 1502.01628 |access-date= 28 April 2018}} {{cite web |title = Small Bodies Data Ferret |work = Nesvorny HCM Asteroid Families V3.0 |url = https://sbntools.psi.edu/ferret/PropertySearch/familyForm.action |accessdate = 1 September 2017}} {{cite journal |display-authors = 6 |first1 = Joseph R. |last1 = Masiero |first2 = A. K. |last2 = Mainzer |first3 = T. |last3 = Grav |first4 = J. M. |last4 = Bauer |first5 = R. M. |last5 = Cutri |first6 = J. |last6 = Dailey |first7 = P. R. M. |last7 = Eisenhardt |first8 = R. S. |last8 = McMillan |first9 = T. B. |last9 = Spahr |first10 = M. F. |last10 = Skrutskie |first11 = D. |last11 = Tholen |first12 = R. G. |last12 = Walker |first13 = E. L. |last13 = Wright |first14 = E. |last14 = DeBaun |first15 = D. |last15 = Elsbury |first16 = T., IV |last16 = Gautier |first17 = S. |last17 = Gomillion |first18 = A. |last18 = Wilkins |date = November 2011 |title = Main Belt Asteroids with WISE/NEOWISE. I. Preliminary Albedos and Diameters |url = http://adsabs.harvard.edu/cgi-bin/bib_query?bibcode=2011ApJ...741...68M |journal = The Astrophysical Journal |volume = 741 |issue = 2 |page = 20 |bibcode = 2011ApJ...741...68M |doi = 10.1088/0004-637X/741/2/68 |arxiv = 1109.4096 |access-date= 12 April 2017}} {{cite web |title = LCDB Data for (52246) Donaldjohanson |publisher = Asteroid Lightcurve Database (LCDB) |url = http://www.minorplanet.info/PHP/GenerateALCDEFPage_Local.php?AstInfo=52246%7CDonaldjohanson |accessdate = 12 April 2017}} }} == External links == * [http://www.minorplanet.info/PHP/lcdbsummaryquery.php Asteroid Lightcurve Database (LCDB)], query form ([http://www.minorplanet.info/lightcurvedatabase.html info]) * [https://books.google.com/books?id=aeAg1X7afOoC&pg Dictionary of Minor Planet Names], Google books * [http://www.minorplanetcenter.net/iau/lists/NumberedMPs050001.html Discovery Circumstances: Numbered Minor Planets (50001)-(55000)] – Minor Planet Center * {{AstDys|52246}} * {{JPL small body}} {{Use dmy dates|date=April 2018}} {{Minor planets navigator| |number=52246| }} {{Small Solar System bodies}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Donaldjohanson}} [[Category:Erigone asteroids|052246]] [[Category:Numbered minor planets|052246]] [[Category:Discoveries by Schelte J. Bus]] [[Category:Minor planets named for people]] [[Category:Named minor planets]] [[Category:Minor planets to be visited by spacecraft|052246]] [[Category:Astronomical objects discovered in 1981|19810302]]

revision.comment: /* Other awards */ no need to specify "(not a Hugo Award)", as the award is in a different section from "Hugo Awards"
revision.text:
{{Infobox convention | name = Denvention 3, the 66th World Science Fiction Convention | image = [[File:Worldcon 66 Denvention 3 logo.png|250px]] | caption = | status = | genre = [[Science fiction]] | venue = [[Colorado Convention Center]] | location = [[Denver]], [[Colorado]] | country = United States | first = August 6–10, 2008 | last = | organizer = | filing = non-profit | attendance = | website = [http://www.fanac.org/Denvention3/ fanac.org/Denvention3] }} The '''66th World Science Fiction Convention''' ([[Worldcon]]), also known as '''Denvention 3''', was hosted in [[Denver, Colorado]], USA on 6–10 August 2008, at the [[Colorado Convention Center]] and [http://www.sheratondenverdowntown.com Sheraton Denver Downtown Hotel] (formerly known as the Adam's Mark Hotel). The organizing committee was chaired by [[Kent Bloom]].{{cite news |work=Colorado Springs Gazette |title=Sci-fi writers, fans gear up for Worldcon |url=http://www.gazette.com/articles/fans_38649___article.html/gear_sci.html |first=Bill |last=Radford |date=2008-07-26}} The attending membership at the convention was 3,751.{{cite journal | title = Denvention 3: The 66th World Science Fiction Convention | journal = Locus | volume = 61 | issue = 4 | pages = 8 | publisher = Locus Publications | location = Oakland, CA | date = October 2008}} == Program and events == === Guests === *Guests of Honor: ** Guest of Honor: [[Lois McMaster Bujold]] ** Artist Guest: [[Rick Sternbach]] ** Fan Guest of Honor: [[Tom Whitmore]] ** Music Guest: [[Kathy Mar]] ** Ghost of Honor: [[Robert A. Heinlein]] *Toastmaster: **[[Wil McCarthy]] === List of notable participants === In addition to the Guests of Honor, the convention has announced the [http://www.denvention.org/programming/bios.php names] of the people participating in the convention program. == Awards presented == {{About-Hugos}} ===Hugo Awards=== *[[Hugo Award for Best Novel|Best Novel]]: ''[[The Yiddish Policemen's Union]] ''by [[Michael Chabon]] *[[Hugo Award for Best Novella|Best Novella]]: "[[All Seated on the Ground]]" by [[Connie Willis]] *[[Hugo Award for Best Novelette|Best Novelette]]: "[[The Merchant and the Alchemist's Gate]]" by [[Ted Chiang]] *[[Hugo Award for Best Short Story|Best Short Story]]: "[[Tideline (short story)|Tideline]]" by [[Elizabeth Bear]] *[[Hugo Award for Best Related Book|Best Related Book]]: ''[[Brave New Words]] ''by Jeff Prucher *[[Hugo Award for Best Dramatic Presentation, Long Form|Best Dramatic Presentation, Long Form]]: ''[[Stardust (2007 film)|Stardust]], ''written by [[Jane Goldman]] & [[Matthew Vaughn]], directed by [[Matthew Vaughn]]. *[[Hugo Award for Best Dramatic Presentation, Short Form|Best Dramatic Presentation, Short Form]]: ''[[Doctor Who]]: [[Blink (Doctor Who)|Blink]]'', written by [[Steven Moffat]], directed by [[Hettie MacDonald]]. *[[Hugo Award for Best Professional Editor#Long Form|Best Professional Editor, Long Form]]: [[David G. Hartwell]] *[[Hugo Award for Best Professional Editor#Short Form|Best Professional Editor, Short Form]]: [[Gordon Van Gelder]] *[[Hugo Award for Best Professional Artist|Best Professional Artist]]: [[Stephan Martinière]] *[[Hugo Award for Best Semiprozine|Best Semiprozine]]: ''[[Locus (magazine)|Locus]]'', edited by [[Charles N. Brown]], Kirsten Gong-Wong & Liza Groen Trombi *[[Hugo Award for Best Fanzine|Best Fanzine]]: ''[[File 770]]'', edited by [[Mike Glyer]] *[[Hugo Award for Best Fan Writer|Best Fan Writer]]: [[John Scalzi]] *[[Hugo Award for Best Fan Artist|Best Fan Artist]]: [[Brad Foster]] ===Other awards=== *[[John W. Campbell Award for Best New Writer]]: [[Mary Robinette Kowal]] *Special Committee Awards (not a Hugo Award): [[NASA]], [[NESFA Press]] == Worldcon site selection == At [[64th World Science Fiction Convention|L.A.con IV]], Denver won the right to host the 66th Worldcon, on the third ballot by 12 votes in one of the closest races in Worldcon site selection history. The members of Denvention 3 selected [[Melbourne]] as the hosting city for the [[68th World Science Fiction Convention]], to be held in 2010. ==References== {{reflist|refs= {{cite web|work=The Hugo Awards |title=2008 Hugo Awards |publisher=[[World Science Fiction Society]] |url=http://www.thehugoawards.org/hugo-history/2008-hugo-awards/ |accessdate=March 4, 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5yVVJFbu3?url=http://www.thehugoawards.org/hugo-history/2008-hugo-awards/ |archivedate=May 7, 2011 }} }} ==External links== * [http://www.fanac.org/Denvention3/ Denvention 3 - the 66th Worldcon] * [http://www.studiorobb.com/ljscott/LJ.html Underrated Science Fiction & Fantasy Panel Films List] {{s-start}} {{succession box | before=[[65th World Science Fiction Convention]]
Nippon 2007 in [[Yokohama]], Japan (2007) | title=[[List of Worldcons]] | years='''66th World Science Fiction Convention'''
Denvention 3 in [[Denver, Colorado|Denver]], United States (2008) | after=[[67th World Science Fiction Convention]]
Anticipation in [[Montréal]], Canada (2009) }} {{s-end}} {{World Science Fiction Convention}} {{DEFAULTSORT:World Science Fiction Convention 066}} [[Category:World Science Fiction Convention]] [[Category:Science fiction conventions in the United States]] [[Category:Culture of Denver]] [[Category:2008 in the United States]] [[Category:2008 in Colorado]] [[Category:2008 conferences]]

Argentina v England (1986 FIFA World Cup)

revision.comment: Reverted 1 edit by [[Special:Contributions/37.36.53.219|37.36.53.219]] ([[User talk:37.36.53.219|talk]]): Reverting edit that created factual error. ([[WP:TW|TW]])
revision.text:
{{Use British English|date=April 2012}} {{Use dmy dates|date=June 2018}} {{Infobox football match | title = 1986 FIFA World Cup
Quarter-final | event = [[1986 FIFA World Cup]] | team1 = [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]] | team1association = {{flagicon|ARG|size=30px}} | team1score = 2 | team2 = [[England national football team|England]] | team2association = {{flagicon|ENG|size=30px}} | team2score = 1 | date = 22 June 1986 | stadium = [[Estadio Azteca]] | city = Mexico City | referee = [[Ali Bin Nasser]] ([[Tunisian Football Federation|Tunisia]]) | attendance = 114,580 | weather = Sunny }} '''Argentina v England''', played on 22 June 1986, was a [[Association football|football]] match between [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]] and [[England national football team|England]] in the quarter-finals of the [[1986 FIFA World Cup]] at the [[Estadio Azteca]] in Mexico City. The game was held four years after the [[Falklands War]] between Argentina and the United Kingdom, and was a key part in the already intense [[Argentina–England football rivalry]]. It was also a match which included two of the most famous goals in football history, both scored by [[Diego Maradona]]. The first goal, after 51 minutes, was to become known as the "Hand of God goal", which Maradona scored by using his hand. His second, four minutes after his first, saw him dribble past five England players, Beardsley, Reid, Butcher, Fenwick, Butcher (again), and finally goalkeeper Peter Shilton, and became known as the "Goal of the Century". Argentina won the game 2–1 and went on to win the 1986 World Cup with a victory over [[Germany national football team|West Germany]] in the [[1986 FIFA World Cup Final|final match]]. Maradona won the [[FIFA World Cup awards|golden ball]] for player of the tournament; England's goalscorer on the day, [[Gary Lineker]], won the [[FIFA World Cup awards|golden boot]] for being the tournament's top scorer. ==Background== ===Argentina–England football rivalry=== {{Main|Argentina–England football rivalry}} British [[expatriate]]s brought football to [[Argentina]] in the 19th century.{{cite news |title=The conflict lives on |first=Simon |last=Kuper |url=https://www.theguardian.com/uk/2002/feb/25/falklands.world8 |newspaper=[[The Guardian]] |date=25 February 2002 |accessdate=10 April 2012 |location=London}} The rivalry between the [[England national football team|England]] and [[Argentina national football team]]s is generally traced back to the [[1966 FIFA World Cup]].[https://www.fifa.com/classicfootball/matches/match=392/report.html Argentina – England] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090122215237/http://www.fifa.com/classicfootball/matches/match%3D392/report.html |date=22 January 2009 }} [[FIFA]] Retrieved 26 January 2009[https://www.theguardian.com/sport/2002/may/19/worldcupfootball2002.football2 England v Argentina – A history] Carlin, John; [[The Observer]]; 19 May 2002; Retrieved 26 January 2009 During the quarter-final game at [[Wembley Stadium (1923)|Wembley Stadium]], the home of the England national team, Argentine captain [[Antonio Rattin]] was [[penalty card#Red card|sent off]] as Argentina lost in a game which contained excessive foul play.[https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/archive/edition=26/overview.html Hurst the hero for England in the home of football] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080124163121/http://www.fifa.com/worldcup/archive/edition%3D26/overview.html |date=24 January 2008 }} FIFA. Retrieved 26 January 2009 Rattin was angered at the sending-off, feeling that the German referee [[Rudolf Kreitlein]], who did not speak Spanish, had been biased towards the English, a fellow European nation, in front of their home fans, and stamped over the royal carpet in the stadium. This led England manager [[Alf Ramsey]] to describe the Argentines as "animals",[http://premium.asia.cnn.com/2002/WORLD/worldcup/05/18/argentina.england/index.html?related New chapter in an historic rivalry] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090528064634/http://premium.asia.cnn.com/2002/WORLD/worldcup/05/18/argentina.england/index.html?related |date=28 May 2009 }} [[CNN]]; 12 May 2002; Retrieved 26 January 2009 comments that were viewed as racist by the Argentines. Despite the popularity of [[Osvaldo Ardiles]] and [[Ricardo Villa]], Argentines who played with [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] in England in an era before it was commonplace for clubs to have non-British players, the rivalry remained strong. Outside football, the [[Falklands War]] in 1982 increased the mistrust between England and Argentina. Britain administrates the [[Falkland Islands]], a small archipelago in the [[South Atlantic Ocean|South Atlantic]], as a British overseas territory; Argentina [[Falkland Islands sovereignty dispute|claims]] the islands as Islas Malvinas. On 2 April 1982, Argentina's forces invaded the islands. Britain considered this an invasion of its territory and sent a naval [[task force]] that recaptured the Islands on 14 June 1982. Though the two nations were never officially at war, the conflict resulted in 258 British and 655 Argentine deaths. As a result, the match taking place four years after the war was emotionally charged. Following the game, Maradona stated: "Although we had said before the game that football had nothing to do with the Malvinas war, we knew they had killed a lot of Argentine boys there, killed them like little birds. And this was revenge." ===1986 FIFA World Cup=== The [[1986 FIFA World Cup]] was held in Mexico after the original hosts, [[Colombia]], were unable to host the tournament. England qualified for the finals undefeated, topping [[1986 FIFA World Cup qualification (UEFA)|Group 3]] in the [[UEFA]] zone; Argentina also topped [[1986 FIFA World Cup qualification (CONMEBOL)|their qualifying group]] in [[CONMEBOL]]. In the early stages of the tournament, Argentina had been comfortable, winning two and drawing one in the group stage. England had qualified more narrowly, with a 3–0 win over [[Poland national football team|Poland]] in the final match putting them into the round of 16. Both teams won comfortably against South American opposition in that round, Argentina against [[Uruguay national football team|Uruguay]] and England against [[Paraguay national football team|Paraguay]]. Although neither team began the tournaments as favourites,[http://www.englandcaps.co.uk/1986EnglandVSArgentina.html 1986 England:Argentina] Englandcaps.co.uk; Retrieved 27 January 2009 England's form had been improving throughout the World Cup and Argentina were buoyed by the skill of Maradona. ===Argentina kit change=== Argentina beat Uruguay 1{{endash}}0 in the round of 16 wearing blue cotton shirts that coach [[Carlos Bilardo]] believed would prove too uncomfortable in the searing Mexico City heat.{{cite web|title=Curious tales of World Cup shirts|url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/news/y=2014/m=5/news=curious-tales-of-world-cup-shirts-2340153.html|work=FIFA.com|accessdate=20 May 2014}} Bilardo asked Argentina's kit manufacturer to come up with lighter blue shirts for the quarter-final, an impossible request given the short deadline. With three days to go before the match, he sent out Ruben Moschella, a member of his coaching staff, to scour the shops of the Mexican capital for a suitable kit. He returned with two different blue shirts, which they subsequently weighed but were unable to choose between. It was then that Diego Maradona appeared and said: "That’s a nice jersey. We’ll beat England in that." Moschella returned to the shop and bought 38 of the shirts for the side to wear against England. A designer fashioned some makeshift [[Argentine Football Association]] (AFA) badges, which were then sewn on to each jersey, with silvery American Football shirt numbers hurriedly ironed on to the backs. ==Match== ===Previous incidents=== Before the [[Argentina and England football rivalry#1986 World Cup|1986 game]] fans from both countries had a fight in [[Mexico City]] streets and into the stadium too.{{cite news |title=No podemos impedir que viajen|publisher=''Clarín'' |date=16 May 2006|url=http://www.clarin.com/diario/2006/05/16/deportes/d-05501.htm|accessdate=6 June 2006}} As a result, several English fans were hospitalised while some of their flags were stolen by Argentine [[barra brava|barrabravas]]. Those flags would be then exhibited by [[Boca Juniors]]'s supporters during some [[Argentine Primera División|Argentine league]] matches.[http://pdf.diariohoy.net/1998/06/23/cla6y7.pdf "Pánico en St. Etienne: Hooligans go home"], 23 June 1998 ===First half=== The game started with both teams exchanging chances. Argentina began to dominate, with England's [[goalkeeper (association football)|goalkeeper]] [[Peter Shilton]] saving several good chances, many created by Maradona. [[Peter Beardsley]] had England's best chance after 13 minutes, following a slip from [[Nery Pumpido]] in Argentina's goal, but failed to take it. At half time, the score was 0{{endash}}0, Argentina having had much more of the possession and territory – and done a great deal more of the running – but having failed to get through England's defence. ===Second half=== It was the second half of the match that was to see the two incidents for which the game was to become both famous and infamous. ====The "Hand of God"==== Six minutes into the second half, Maradona cut inside from the left and played a diagonal low pass to the edge of the area to teammate [[Jorge Valdano]] and continued his run in the hope of a one-two movement. Maradona's pass was played slightly behind Valdano and reached England's [[Steve Hodge]], the [[midfielder|left midfielder]] who had dropped back to defend. Hodge tried to hook the ball clear but miscued it. The ball looped off his foot and into the penalty area, toward Maradona, who had continued his run. England goalkeeper [[Peter Shilton]] came out of his goal to punch the ball clear. Maradona, despite being 8 inches (20 cm) shorter than the 6-foot-1 (1.85 m) Shilton, reached it first with his outside left hand. The ball bounced into the goal. [[referee (association football)|Referee]] [[Ali Bin Nasser]] of [[Tunisia]] said he did not see the infringement and allowed the goal.{{cite web|url= https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2014/apr/08/world-cup-moments-maradona-hand-god|title= World Cup: 25 stunning moments … No9: Diego Maradona's Hand of God|date=8 April 2014|work=Guardian|accessdate=2 April 2015}} Maradona later said, "I was waiting for my teammates to embrace me, and no one came... I told them, 'Come hug me, or the referee isn't going to allow it.'"Bechtel, Mark. [http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/2005/writers/mark_bechtel/08/24/daily.blog/index.html "The Right Way to Cheat: Pulling a Fast One Is Sometimes Part of the Game"]. CNNSI. 24 August 2005. Retrieved 19 May 2006. At the post-game press conference, Maradona facetiously commented that the goal was scored ''"un poco con la cabeza de Maradona y otro poco con la mano de Dios"'' ("a little with the head of Maradona and a little with the hand of God"), after which it became known as the "Hand of God" goal.{{cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/early-lead/wp/2017/07/26/diego-maradona-admits-video-replay-would-have-erased-his-hand-of-god-goal/?noredirect=on|title=Diego Maradona admits video replay would have erased his ‘Hand of God’ goal - The Washington Post|last=Bonesteel|first=Mark|date=26 July 2017|work=[[The Washington Post]]|accessdate=22 June 2018}} The goal helped intensify the footballing rivalry between the two nations.{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/diego-maradona-the-hand-of-god-the-most-infamous-goal-in/15sev9f2t2sn814f2n8d2ah3zc|title=Diego Maradona & the Hand of God: The most infamous goal in World Cup history|work=[[Goal (website)|Goal]]|accessdate=22 June 2018}} [[Cesar Luis Menotti]] said, "People said, 'Great! Better, much better, that the goal was so unjust, so cruel, because it hurt the English more.'"{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/sport/2002/may/19/worldcupfootball2002.football2|title=England v Argentina - A history|last=Carlin|first=John|date=19 May 2002|work=[[TheGuardian.com]]|accessdate=22 June 2018}} ====The Goal of the Century==== [[File:Maradona gol a inglaterra.jpg|thumb|right|[[Diego Maradona]] running to the goal, while [[Terry Butcher]] tries to stop him.]] [[File:Maradona scoring england 1986.jpg|thumb|right|Maradona scoring the "Goal of the Century" after dribbling past goalkeeper [[Peter Shilton]]. Butcher (6) fails to stop the shot.]] [[File:Maradona vs england.jpg|thumb|right|Maradona celebrating the goal. Butcher (6) is seated on the field.]] Four minutes after the ''Hand of God'' goal came ''The Goal of the Century'', which is often said to be the greatest individual goal of all time. Midfielder [[Héctor Enrique]] passed the ball to Maradona inside his own half. Maradona then began his 60-yard, 10-second dash towards the English goal, passing four English outfield players: [[Peter Beardsley]], [[Peter Reid]], [[Terry Butcher]] (twice) and [[Terry Fenwick]]. Maradona finished the move with a [[Dummy (football)|feint]] that left goalkeeper [[Peter Shilton]] on his bottom, before slotting the ball into the net to make the score 2–0 to Argentina.[https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/world-cup/6700645/Top-10-World-Cup-goals.html?mobile=basic "Top 10 World Cup goals"]. The Telegraph. Retrieved 19 August 2014 About the goal, Maradona said, "I made the play to give it to [[Jorge Valdano|Valdano]], but when I got to the area they surrounded me and I had no space. Therefore, I had to continue the play and finish it myself."Maradona, D. ''Maradona: The Autobiography of Soccer's Greatest and Most Controversial Star'', p.129. Skyhorse Publishing, 2007. {{ISBN|1-60239-027-4}}. He later complimented the fair play of the English team, saying, "I don't think I could have done it against any other team because they all used to knock you down; they are probably the noblest in the world".{{cite news|url=http://www.rediff.com/sports/football/2002/may/30mara.htm|title=Maradona's strike is goal of century|publisher=Rediff.com|date=30 May 2002}} In 2002, the goal was voted 'Goal of the Century' as part of the buildup to the [[2002 FIFA World Cup]] tournament on the [[FIFA]] [[website]].{{cite web |url=https://www.fifa.com/newscentre/news/newsid=82406/index.html |title=Diego Maradona goal voted the FIFA World Cup Goal of the Century |date=30 May 2002 |publisher=FIFA |accessdate=10 April 2012}} It beat a goal scored by England's [[Michael Owen]] against Argentina in the [[1998 FIFA World Cup]], which came second, whilst another 1986 FIFA World Cup goal by Maradona, from the semi-final match against [[Belgium national football team|Belgium]], came fourth. In Spanish-speaking countries, this goal is usually associated with the live commentary by Uruguayan journalist [[Víctor Hugo Morales]] (translation from Spanish): {{quotation|He's going to pass it to Diego, there's Maradona with it, two men on him, Maradona steps on the ball, there goes down the right flank the genius of world football, he leaves the wing and he's going to pass it to Burruchaga... Still Maradona! Genius! Genius! Genius! There, there, there, there, there, there! Goaaaaaaaal! Goaaaaaaal! I want to cry, oh holy God, long live football! What a goal! Diegoal! Maradona! It is to cry for, excuse me! Maradona, in a memorable run, in the best play of all times! Little cosmic kite, which planet did you come from, to leave so many Englishmen behind, so that the country becomes a clenched fist crying for Argentina? Argentina 2, England 0! Diegoal, Diegoal, Diego Armando Maradona! Thank you, God, for football, for Maradona, for these tears, for this Argentina 2, England 0.|Víctor Hugo Morales{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7404jcxTu0o|title=Maradona Gol a los ingleses por V H morales|editor=Youtube|date=25 April 2007|accessdate=18 November 2013}}}} ====Lineker's goal and Argentine victory==== Argentina's lead forced England into a double-attacking substitution, bringing on Barnes and Waddle, and it nearly paid off: as the Argentine team began to tire after their earlier efforts, England began to push further up the pitch, looking to get back into the game. Driven by [[Glenn Hoddle]] and [[John Barnes (footballer)|John Barnes]], they created chances, and [[Gary Lineker]] scored his sixth goal of the tournament in the 80th minute from a Barnes cross. Argentina had further chances as well, with [[Carlos Daniel Tapia|Carlos Tapia]] hitting the inside of the post immediately after England's goal. England were unable to score an equaliser and Argentina won the match 2–1. ==Aftermath== Hodge swapped shirts with Maradona after the game; Hodge lent out the Argentine's jersey to the [[National Football Museum]] in the 2000s. The game added hugely to the rivalry between the two teams. In Argentina, the game was seen as revenge for the [[Falklands War]] and for what they still see as [[Argentina–England football rivalry#1966 World Cup|the unfair game]] in the [[1966 FIFA World Cup|1966 World Cup]]. The former Argentine international [[Roberto Perfumo]] stated that "In 1986, winning that game against England was enough. Winning the World Cup was secondary for us. Beating England was our real aim". Although the first goal proved highly controversial in England, Maradona's second goal was nevertheless recognized all over the world for its brilliance. A notable example of the English appreciation of his genius occurred in a 2002 poll conducted by [[Channel 4]], where the UK public voted Maradona's performance sixth in the list of the [[100 Greatest (UK TV series)|100 Greatest Sporting Moments]].{{cite web|url=http://www.channel4.com/entertainment/tv/microsites/G/greatest_sporting/results.html |title=100 Greatest Sporting Moments – Results |work=[[Channel 4]] |accessdate=10 April 2012}} Outside the Estadio Azteca a statue of Maradona scoring the goal was erected to commemorate the moment.{{cite web |url=http://worldrec.info/2007/04/28/messis-goal-better-than-maradonas-goal-of-the-century/ |title=Messi's goal better than Maradona's goal of the century? |date=28 April 2007 |work= |publisher= |accessdate=10 April 2012}} Argentina went on to win the [[1986 FIFA World Cup]] by defeating [[Germany national football team|West Germany]] in the [[1986 FIFA World Cup Final|final match]], as well as finishing runners-up in the [[1990 FIFA World Cup]]. England's Lineker won the Golden Boot for being top scorer in the 1986 FIFA World Cup. With a similar squad, England finished fourth in the 1990 FIFA World Cup, their highest finish since 1966. The two teams have since met twice in World Cup matches. Argentina won a round-of-16 match in the shootout at the [[1998 FIFA World Cup]], after one [[Penalty kick (association football)|penalty kick]] was awarded to each side, [[David Beckham]] was sent off, [[Sol Campbell]] had a goal disallowed and [[Michael Owen]] scored his famous goal. At the [[2002 FIFA World Cup]], the teams met in the group stage, and the match, which began at 12:30 PM UK time, was described as the "longest lunch break in history" as millions in England stopped their jobs and activities to watch the game on TV. England won 1–0 courtesy of a foul by [[Mauricio Pochettino]] on Michael Owen. David Beckham's penalty kick won the match for England and Argentina later failed to advance to the knockout round.{{cite web|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=O_EyAAAAIBAJ&sjid=pwgGAAAAIBAJ&pg=5479,1886237&dq=longest+lunch+break+england+argentina&hl=en|title=The Free Lance-Star - Google News Archive Search|website=news.google.com}} On 17 August 2015, Maradona visited [[Ali Bin Nasser]], the referee of the 1986 World Cup quarter-final, at his home in Tunisia, and paid tribute to him by giving him an Argentine jersey bearing his signature, and referred to him as "my eternal friend".{{cite web|url=http://www.marca.com/en/2015/08/17/en/football/international_football/1439845054.html|title=International football: Maradona holds up his hands in apology - MARCA.com (English version)|first=|last=MARCA.com|publisher=}}{{cite web|url=http://www.dailystar.co.uk/news/latest-news/459978/Argentine-Diego-Maradona-ref-Ali-Bennaceur-Hand-of-God-goal|title='My eternal friend': Diego Maradona meets infamous ref who gave 'Hand of God' goal|date=18 August 2015|publisher=}}{{cite web|url=http://elpais.com/elpais/2015/08/18/inenglish/1439899213_516413.html|title=Maradona visits Tunisian referee who awarded him 1986 “Hand of God” goal|first=Alejandro|last=Rebossio|date=18 August 2015|publisher=}}{{cite web|url=http://english.alarabiya.net/en/sports/2015/08/18/Soccer-Hugged-by-the-hands-of-God-infamous-ref-meets-Maradona.html|title=Maradona meets infamous ‘hand of God’ referee in Tunisia|website=english.alarabiya.net}} ==Details== {{football box |date = 22 June 1986 |time = 12:00 [[Central Time Zone|CST]] |team1 = {{fb-rt|ARG}} |score = 2–1 |report = [https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/matches/round=714/match=392/index.html Report] |team2 = {{fb|ENG}} |goals1 = [[Diego Maradona|Maradona]] {{goal|51||55}} |goals2 = [[Gary Lineker|Lineker]] {{goal|81}} |stadium = [[Estadio Azteca]], [[Mexico City]] |attendance = 114,580 |referee = [[Ali Bin Nasser]] ([[Tunisian Football Federation|Tunisia]])[http://www.englandfootballonline.com/Seas1980-90/1985-86/M0618Arg1986.html England National Football Team Match No. 618] England football online; Retrieved 28 January 2009 }} {| width=92% |- |{{Football kit | pattern_la = _whiteborder | pattern_b = _vneckwhite | pattern_ra = _whiteborder | leftarm = 4169E1 | body = 4169E1 | rightarm = 4169E1 | shorts = 000000 | socks = FFFFFF | title = Argentina }} |{{Football kit | pattern_la = _blueborder | pattern_b = _vneckblue | pattern_ra = _blueborder | leftarm = FFFFFF | body = FFFFFF | rightarm = FFFFFF | shorts = E0FFFF | socks = E0FFFF | title = England }} |} {| style="width:100%" |- |style="vertical-align:top; width:40%"| {| cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-size:90%" |- !width=25| !!width=25| |- |GK ||'''18'''||[[Nery Pumpido]] |- |DF ||'''5''' ||[[José Luis Brown]] |- |DF ||'''9''' ||[[José Luis Cuciuffo]] |- |DF ||'''19'''||[[Oscar Ruggeri]] |- |MF ||'''12'''||[[Héctor Enrique]] |- |MF ||'''14'''||[[Ricardo Giusti]] |- |MF ||'''2''' ||[[Sergio Batista]] || {{yel|60}} |- |MF ||'''7''' ||[[Jorge Burruchaga]] || || {{suboff|75}} |- |MF ||'''16'''||[[Julio Olarticoechea]] |- |FW
